# Falcon Signature Scheme

A C++ implementation of the Falcon signature scheme, a post-quantum cryptographic algorithm.

## Table of Contents

- [Introduction](#introduction)
- [Getting Started](#getting-started)
- [Running the Project](#running-the-project)
- [Example Output](#example-output)

## Introduction

This project creates a keypair using the Falcon signature scheme, a post-quantum cryptographic algorithm. The Falcon algorithm is based on NTRU lattices and uses a hash-and-sign structure with a Fourier-based sampling method.

## Getting Started

To get started with this project, follow these steps:

**Clone the Repository**

```bash
git clone https://github.com/akhilparakka/falcon-signature-scheme.git
```

**Create a Build Folder**

```bash
mkdir build
```

**Change into the Build Folder**

```bash
cd build
```

**Run CMake**

```bash
cmake ..
make
```

## Running the Project

When you run the project, it will generate a keypair using the Falcon signature scheme. The public and private keys will be printed to the console in hexadecimal format.

**Run the Project**

```bash
./falcon-signature
```

## Example Output

Here is an example of the output you can expect:

```bash
Public key: 

Private key: 
```

Note that the actual output will be different each time you run the project, as the keys are generated randomly.
